com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container

Class AbstractContainerHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container.AbstractContainerHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpServletHelper

    public abstract class AbstractContainerHelper
extends Object

    This class exists to enable sharing of features that are common between Servlet and Portlet handling of WComponents.

    Instances of this support class are intended to be short lived. An instance of this class is intended to be created to help service a single request and then be thrown away.

    Author:
    Martin Shevchenko

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractContainerHelper.UIContextWrap
      This class exists because we'd like to simulate clustering while still being able to use the UIContext as the synchronization lock when servicing a request.

      • getUIContext

        protected abstract UIContext getUIContext()
        Retrieves the UIContext from session. If the session does not yet exist or the UIContext is not yet created and saved, then this method returns null.
        Returns:
        the UIContext in the session, or null if it does not exist.

      • setUIContext

        Saves the UIContext in session.
        Parameters:
        uiContext - the ui context to save.

      • cycleUIContext

        protected void cycleUIContext()
        Call this method to simulate what would happen if the UIContext was serialized due to clustering of servers.

        Prepare the session for the current request.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Marks the helper as disposed. A disposed helper does not take part in action or render processing.

      • isDisposed

        protected boolean isDisposed()
        Indicates whether the helper has been disposed. A disposed helper does not take part in action or render processing.
        Returns:
        true if the helper is disposed, false otherwise.

        Indicates whether this is a new conversation (session).

        protected boolean isContinuingConversation()
        Indicates whether this is a continuing conversation (session).
        Returns:
        true if a continuing conversation, false if new.

      • handleLogout

        protected void handleLogout()
        The application can ask the Container to "log out" by setting the logout attribute on the Request. This method is called in response to that.

        It invalidates the session and redirects the browser to the root of the web application.

      • getResponse

        protected abstract Response getResponse()
        Returns:
        the response for this helper.

      • invalidateSession

        protected abstract void invalidateSession()
        Invalidates the underlying session.

      • redirectForLogout

        protected abstract void redirectForLogout()
        Redirects the client to a URL after the log-out process is complete. The URL is specified by the configuration parameter bordertech.wcomponents.logout.url. Note that this method is called after invalidateSession(), so there may not be any session information available.

      • addGenericHeaders

        protected void addGenericHeaders(UIContext uic,
                     WComponent ui)
        Subclasses can override this method to add extra headers. They can do this by obtaining the top ui component's WHeaders object and adding headers to it. Adding generic headers makes sense for servlets but maybe not portlets.
        Parameters:
        uic - the current user context
        ui - the WComponent UI which is handling the request.

      • getPrintWriter

        protected abstract PrintWriter getPrintWriter()
                                       throws IOException
        Retrieves the PrintWriter which is used to send data back to the client.
        Returns:
        the PrintWriter for this helper.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error obtaining the PrintWriter.
